intro: Aeschynomene muricata, commonly known as the hairy leaf desmodium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are often hairy and have a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils. Aeschynomene muricata is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it valuable in agricultural settings. Its adaptability to various soil types contributes to its widespread distribution in its native range.
